column1: 1. The IT Act, 2000 contains three provisions on data protection and privacy. Which of the following is not amongst the three
column2: (a) Section 43A
column3: (b) Section 72A

column2: (a) Section 43A
column3: (b) Section 43

column1: 3. RSPP stands for
column2: (a) Reliable Security Practices and Procedures
column3: (b) Reasonable Security Practices and Procedures

column1: 4. SPDI stands for
column2: (a) Sensitive Public Data and Information
column3: (b) Sensitive Private Data and Information
column5: (d) Serious and Protective Data and Information

column1: 5. The law provides
column2: (a) only compensation, and only when a wrongful gain or loss results from the failure to observe RSPP
column3: (b) only imprisonment, and only when a wrongful gain or loss results from the failure to observe RSPP

column1: 6. RSPP is defined to mean
column2: (a) such procedures stated by a law in force
column3: (b) such procedures as agreed to by the parties
column4: (c) in the absence of both, the rules framed by the government.

column1: 7. Pick the correct one
column2: (a) There is no statute that prescribes RSPP.
column3: (b) If parties agree on the RSPP to be adopted, the rules of the government would not apply.

column1: 8. Which of the following Section of IT Act provides for criminal punishment if, in the course of performing a contract, a service provider discloses personal information without the consent of the person concerned or in breach of a lawful contract and he or she does so with the intention to cause, or knowing he or she is likely to cause, wrongful loss or wrongful gain?
column2: (a) Section 72
column3: (b) Section 72A

column1: 9. Which of the following Section of IT Act prescribes criminal punishment if a government official discloses records and information accessed by him or her in the course of his or her duties without the consent of the concerned person or unless permitted by other laws?
column2: (a) Section 72
column3: (b) Section 72A

column1: 10. Which authority is responsible for overseeing the data protection law?
column2: (a) There is no specific data protection authority in India.
column3: (b) The IT Act provides for an adjudicating officer to be appointed to adjudicate whether a person has contravened the IT Act or its rules where the claim of injury or damages does not exceed 50 million rupees.
column4: (c) If the claim exceeds 50 million rupees, the adjudicating authority would be the civil court

column1: 11. Who has been appointed as the Adjudicating Officer?
column2: (a) The Secretary to the Ministry of Information Technology in each state government
column3: (b) The Secretary to the Ministry of Law
column4: (c) The Registrar of the Supreme Court and High Courts of India

column1: 12. The adjudicating officer
column2: (a) does not have power of a Civil Courts
column3: (b) has all powers of a Civil Court.
column4: (c) has all powers of a High Court.

column1: 13. Data protection authority in India is
column2: (a) Secretary to Ministry of Information and Technology
column3: (b) Court of Law
column5: (d) There is no data protection authority in India.

column1: 14. Section 43A of IT Acts provides for compensation, if a breach results in a wrongful gain or wrongful loss that should not exceed
column2: (a) Rs. 5 lakh
column3: (b) Rs. 10 lakh
column5: (d) does not prescribe the maximum compensation

column1: 15. Under section 72, the punishment is
column2: (a) imprisonment of up to three years
column3: (b) a fine of up to 100,000 rupees
column4: (c) either A or B or both

column1: 16. Under section 72A, the punishment is
column2: (a) imprisonment of up to three years
column3: (b) a fine of up to 100,000 rupees
column4: (c) either A or B or both

column1: 17. Pick the correct one
column2: (a) The provisions under the IT Act apply to all sectors, though laws specific to particular sectors would apply concurrently.
column3: (b) Section 43A covers all types of organisations. Section 72 relates only to a government officer.
column4: (c) Section 72A relates to a body corporate and the rules issued thereunder exclude government from the meaning of body corporate.

column1: 18. State whether true of False The data protection law does not cover interception of communications, electronic marketing or monitoring and surveillance of individuals
column2: (a) True
column3: (b) False

column1: 19. Which of the following does not permit the government to engage in surveillance based on certain criteria?
column2: (a) the Indian Telegraph Act 1885
column3: (b) the Information Technology Act 2000

column2: (a) i, ii, iv and v
column3: (b) ii, iii, iv and v

column1: 21. All surveillance has to be approved except
column2: (a) in writing by the Home Secretary of the central government
column3: (b) in writing by the Home Secretary the relevant state government

column3: (b) Artificial person

column1: 25. SPDI covers the i. passwords ii. financial information such as bank account or credit card or debit card or other payment instrument details iii. physical, physiological and mental health conditions iv. sexual orientation; medical records and history v. biometric information.
column2: (a) I, ii, iii and iv
column3: (b) i, iii, iv and v

column1: 26. Pick the incorrect one
column2: (a) The laws on Personal Information does not distinguish personal information on the basis of the format of the information, such as electronic as opposed to physical records.
column3: (b) The laws on SPDI are also applicable to SPDI in electronic as well as physical form.

column1: 27. Pick the correct one
column2: (a) reach of the law restricted to only to a body corporate or person located within India.
column3: (b) Data processing as a result of a contract between two entities is not covered by the privacy rules
column4: (c) The law does allow transfer of SPDI out of India only if the recipient ensures the same level of data protection.

column1: 28. Pick the correct one
column2: (a) SPDI cannot be collected unless the information is collected for a lawful purpose connected with a function or activity of the party collecting or using the information and the collection of the SPDI is considered necessary for that purpose.
column3: (b) There are also notice and consent requirements.

column1: 29. While collecting SPDI, the provider must be made aware through reasonable steps of the
column2: (a) the fact that the information is being collected and the purpose for which it is collected
column3: (b) the intended recipients of the information
column4: (c) the name and address of the agency collecting or retaining the information.

column1: 30. Privacy rules
column2: (a) do apply to the government
column3: (b) do not apply to the government
column5: (d) do apply to the government partially.

column1: 31. State whether true or false The privacy rules offer individuals certain degree of choice or control over the use of their information.
column2: (a) True
column3: (b) False

column1: 32. Privacy rules
column2: (a) specify that the SPDI cannot be retained for longer than is required for the purpose for which the information can lawfully be used or is otherwise required under any other law currently in force.
column3: (b) specify that the SPDI can be retained for longer than is required for the purpose for which the information can lawfully be used or is otherwise required under any other law currently in force
column4: (c) specify that the SPDI can or cannot be retained for longer than is required for the purpose for which the information can lawfully be used or is otherwise required under any other law currently in force depending upon purpose
column5: (d) do not specify any thing with regard to retention of the SPDI

column1: 33. Pick the correct one
column2: (a) The privacy rules merely suggest that IS/ISO/IEC 27001 or a code prescribed by an industry association and approved by the government could be used. So far, no code has been approved by the government.
column3: (b) The banking regulations require banks to follow ISO/IEC 27001 and ISO/IEC 27002. Similarly, the securities exchange regulations require stock exchanges, depositories and clearing corporations to follow standards such as ISO 27001, ISO 27002, COBIT 5, etc.

column1: 34. In case of any cybersecurity incident banks are required to inform the Reserve Bank of India within
column2: (a) one to two hours
column3: (b) two to six hours.

column1: 35. CERT stands for
column2: (a) Computer Emergency Response Team
column3: (b) Cyber Exposure Response Team

column1: 36. Pick the correct one
column2: (a) The Ministry of Communication and Information Technology has set up CERT under the IT Act.
column3: (b) CERT is the nodal agency for resolving cybersecurity incidents in India. It is responsible for scanning cyberspace for cybersecurity vulnerabilities, breaches and malicious activity and can block web pages and websites.

column1: 37. The privacy rules provide for the need to
column2: (a) appoint a grievance officer to address discrepancies and grievances of providers of information.
column3: (b) appoint a data protection officer to protect the data provided by owner of the information

column1: 38. Under privacy rules
column2: (a) owners or processors of PII are required to maintain any internal records or establish internal processes or documentation.
column3: (b) owners or processors of PII are not required to maintain any internal records or establish internal processes or documentation
column4: (c) No requirements have been prescribed for maintaining internal records or establishing internal processes or documentation except the suggestion in the privacy rules that IS/ISO/IEC 27001 is one such security standard that could be adopted.

column1: 39. Cross-border transfer of PII
column2: (a) require notification to or authorisation from a supervisory authority
column3: (b) does not require notification to or authorisation from a supervisory authority
column4: (c) require notification to or authorisation from a supervisory authority in certain cases

column1: 46. Pick the correct one
column2: (a) Indian law does not deal directly with the use of cookies or equivalent technology
column3: (b) Indian law does not deal with marketing through email or fax. The IT Act does not cover electronic marketing. This is covered by ‘do not call’ rules framed by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI).
column4: (c) A person is entitled to three counts - on the third count, the person will be blacklisted and cannot receive any telecom resources for a period of two years.

column2: (a) August 2017

column2: (a) 1st December 2018

column1: 50. Pick the incorrect one
column2: (a) Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019 is India’s first attempt towards a specific data protection and privacy statue in India
column3: (b) The Bill contains 10 Chapter and 112 Sections
column4: (c) A large portion of the Bill seems to have been adopted from the recent global data protection regulations of the EU and it includes concepts such as the right to be forgotten, privacy-by-design, consent-based approach, data localisation requirements, data protection officers and data protection authority among others.
